citation.article-title: Okibacterium fritillariae gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel genus of the family Microbacteriaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Okibacterium (O.ki.bac.teÂ«ri.um. N.L. n. Oka, the name of the river ; Gr. n. bakterion small rod; N.L. neut. n. Okibacterium a bacterium isolated from plants occurring near the Oka river)
Cells are Gram-positive, non-sporulating, irregular rods.
Cell wall peptidoglycan of B-type contains lysine as a diamino acid.
Muramic acid occurs in the N-glycolyl form.
The major menaquinones are MK-10 and MK-11, with minor amounts of MK-9 and MK-8.
The principal phospholipids are phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol.
Among the fatty acids, anteiso-15:0 and anteiso- 17:0 are predominant. f content of DNA is approximately 67 mol%.
A wide range of carbon sources are used for growth.
Forms a separate branch within the phylogenetic cluster of the family Microbacteriaceae.
Salient properties that differentiate the new genus from other genera of this family are summarized in Tables 1 and 2.
The type species is Okibacterium fritillariae.
